Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Carpentry \Car"pen*try\, n. [F. charpenterie, OF. also carpenterie. See {Carpenter}.] [1913 Webster] 1. The art of cutting, framing, and joining timber, as in the construction of buildings. [1913 Webster]
2. An assemblage of pieces of timber connected by being framed together, as the pieces of a roof, floor, etc.; work done by a carpenter. [1913 Webster]
carpentry n : the craft of a carpenter: making things out of wood [syn: {woodworking}, {woodwork}]
